1.text: Call now; is there any that will answer thee? and to which of the holy ones wilt thou turn?

2.text: For vexation killeth the foolish man, and jealousy slayeth the silly one.

3.text: I have seen the foolish taking root: but suddenly I cursed his habitation.

4.text: His children are far from safety, and they are crushed in the gate, neither is there any to deliver them.

5.text: Whose harvest the hungry eateth up, and taketh it even out of the thorns, and the snare gapeth for their substance.

6.text: For affliction cometh not forth of the dust, neither doth trouble spring out of the ground;

7.text: But man is born unto trouble, as the sparks fly upward.

8.text: But as for me, I would seek unto God, and unto God would I commit my cause:

9.text: Which doeth great things and unsearchable; marvelous things without number:

10.text: Who giveth rain upon the earth, and sendeth waters upon the fields:

11.text: So that he setteth up on high those that be low; and those which mourn are exalted to safety.

12.text: He frustrateth the devices of the crafty, so that their hands cannot perform their enterprise.

13.text: He taketh the wise in their own craftiness: and the counsel of the froward is carried headlong.

14.text: They meet with darkness in the daytime, and grope at noonday as in the night.

15.text: But he saveth from the sword of their mouth, even the needy from the hand of the mighty.

16.text: So the poor hath hope, and iniquity stoppeth her mouth.

17.text: Behold, happy is the man whom God correcteth: therefore despise not thou the chastening of the Almighty.

18.text: For he maketh sore, and bindeth up; he woundeth, and his hands make whole.

19.text: He shall deliver thee in six troubles; yea, in seven there shall no evil touch thee.

20.text: In famine he shall redeem thee from death; and in war from the power of the sword.

21.text: Thou shalt be hid from the scourge of the tongue; neither shalt thou be afraid of destruction when it cometh.

22.text: At destruction and dearth thou shalt laugh; neither shalt thou be afraid of the beasts of the earth.

23.text: For thou shalt be in league with the stones of the field; and the beasts of the field shall be at peace with thee.

24.text: And thou shalt know that thy tent is in peace; and thou shalt visit thy fold, and shalt miss nothing.

25.text: Thou shalt know also that thy seed shall be great, and thine offspring as the grass of the earth.

26.text: Thou shalt come to thy grave in a full age, like as a shock of corn cometh in in its season.

27.text: Lo this, we have searched it, so it is; hear it, and know thou it for thy good.
